intro: Actephila dolichopoda, commonly known as the slender bristled sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes and wetlands. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually green or brown in color. Actephila dolichopoda is often found in temperate regions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in aquatic habitats. Its morphology and growth habits make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
